chapter.pericope: Yahweh Brings a Charge against Israel

ul.li1: 1Hear now what Yahweh says:
“Arise! Plead your case with the mountains,
ul.li2: and let the hills hear your voice.”
ul.li1: 2Hear, O mountains, the indictment of Yahweh,
ul.li2: and you eternal foundations of the earth,
ul.li1: for Yahweh has an indictment against his people,
ul.li2: and against Israel he contends.
ul.li1: 3“O my people, what have I done to you,
ul.li2: and how have I wearied you? Answer me!
ul.li1: 4For I brought you up from the land of Egypt,
ul.li2: and from the house of slavery I redeemed you.
And I sent Moses, Aaron, and Miriam before you.
ul.li1: 5O my people, remember what Balak the king of Moab devised,
ul.li2: and what Balaam the son of Beor answered him,
ul.li1: and what happened from Shittim to Gilgal,
ul.li2: so that you might know the righteous acts of Yahweh.”

ul.li1: 6With what shall I approach Yahweh,
ul.li2: and bow down to God on high?
ul.li1: Shall I approach him with burnt offerings,
ul.li2: with bull calves a year old?
ul.li1: 7Will Yahweh be pleased with thousands of rams,
ul.li2: with myriads of rivers of oil?
ul.li1: Shall I give my firstborn for my transgression,
ul.li2: the fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?
ul.li1: 8He has told you, O mortal, what is good,
ul.li2: and what does Yahweh ask from you
ul.li1: but to do justice, and to love kindness,
ul.li2: and to walk humbly with your God?

ul.li1: 9The voice of Yahweh calls to the city
ul.li2: (it is sound judgment to fear your name):
“Hear, O staff!Or “tribe” Now who has appointed it?
ul.li1: 10Is there any longer a man in the house of the wicked
ul.li2: treasures of wickedness,
and the ephah of scarcity which is accursed?The meaning of the Hebrew text is uncertain
ul.li1: 11Shall I regard as pure the one with scales of wickedness,
ul.li2: and with a bag of deceitful weights?
ul.li1: 12Because her rich are full of violence,
ul.li2: and her inhabitants speak lies,
and their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.
ul.li1: 13And I also have made you sick by striking you down,Literally “I have made sick to strike you down”
ul.li2: making you desolate because of your sins.
ul.li1: 14You yourself will eat but not be satisfied;
ul.li2: your hunger will be in your midst,
ul.li1: and you will put away, but you will not save,
ul.li2: and what you save I will hand over to the sword.
ul.li1: 15You yourself will sow, but you will not reap;
ul.li2: you will tread olives, but you will not anoint yourself with oil;
you will tread grapes, but you will not drink wine.
ul.li1: 16For you have observed the regulations of Omri
ul.li2: and all the works of the house of Ahab.
ul.li1: And you have walked in their counsels,
ul.li2: so that I am making you a desolation
ul.li1: and your inhabitants an object of scorn.
ul.li2: So you will bear the scorn of my people.
